title: Greek Yogurt Tartare Sauce
description: A lighter, tangy take on classic tartare sauce using Greek yogurt and mayo. Great for fish, fries, or sandwiches.
ingredients: 2 tbsp finely chopped pickles (dill pickles preferred)
1 tsp pickle brine (optional, for extra tang)
1/2 tsp lemon juice or 1/8 tsp lemon juice concentrate
Pinch of salt and black pepper
Optional: 1 tsp finely minced onion or shallot
Optional: 1 tsp chopped fresh dill or parsley
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise and Greek yogurt until smooth.
Add chopped pickles, pickle brine, Dijon mustard, and lemon juice. Stir to combine.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Optional: mix in onion, shallot, dill, or parsley for added flavor.
Chill in the refrigerator for 10â€“15 minutes to let the flavors meld before serving.
notes: For a tangier version, increase Greek yogurt to 4 tbsp and reduce mayo to 1 tbsp. Pairs beautifully with baked or air-fried fish, sweet potato fries, or turkey burgers.
